project_description: A Flutter project using the Stacked architecture, featuring routing, dependency injection, and dialog/bottom sheet management.
architecture_overview: The application follows the Stacked architecture with separate folders for app setup, features, UI components, and utilities. It uses Stacked for state management, routing, and dependency injection.

files.name: lib/app/app.dart
files.description: Defines the app structure using StackedApp annotation for routes, dependencies, bottom sheets, and dialogs. It includes routes (HomeView, StartupView), services (BottomSheetService, DialogService, NavigationService), bottom sheets (NoticeSheet), and dialogs (InfoAlertDialog). The file structure allows for easy addition of new services, routes, bottom sheets, and dialogs using the @stacked-import, @stacked-route, @stacked-service, @stacked-bottom-sheet, and @stacked-dialog annotations.

files.name: lib/features/app/app_view.dart
files.description: Defines the root widget of the application. So this files can not be deleted at all.

files.name: lib/features/home/home_view.dart
files.description: The main home view of the application.

files.name: lib/features/home/home_viewmodel.dart
files.description: ViewModel for the HomeView, manages the state and business logic.

files.name: lib/features/startup/startup_view.dart
files.description: The startup view shown when the app is first launched.

files.name: lib/features/startup/startup_viewmodel.dart
files.description: ViewModel for the StartupView, handles initialization logic.

methods.name: runStartupLogic
methods.description: Runs the startup logic and navigates to the home view

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The entry point of the application. Sets up the app and runs it.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The main function that runs the app

dependencies.name: stacked
dependencies.purpose: Stacked architecture for state management and routing

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant main
participant AppView
participant StartupView
participant StartupViewModel
participant HomeView
participant HomeViewModel

User -> main: Launch app
main -> AppView: Create and run
AppView -> StartupView: Initialize
StartupView -> StartupViewModel: Run startup logic
StartupViewModel -> HomeView: Navigate on completion
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Initialize
User -> HomeView: Interact
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Handle user actions
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Update UI
HomeViewModel -> DialogService: Show dialog
HomeViewModel -> BottomSheetService: Show bottom sheet
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Stacked architecture. ViewModels (e.g., HomeViewModel, StartupViewModel) handle the business logic and state for their respective views. The app.locator.dart file sets up dependency injection, while app.router.dart manages navigation between views.
navigation_flow: The application starts with main.dart, which sets up the app and runs AppView. AppView initializes the Stacked architecture and shows the StartupView. After completing initialization logic, it navigates to the HomeView. Navigation between views is handled by the Stacked Router defined in app.router.dart.
